page.title: 04PEASEDOWN ST JOHN
page.content:
Peasedown, the largest of the villages in the area, is a typical example of 1930's ribbon development. It consists of three parts ,Peasedown, Lower Peasedown and Ashgrove, all of which have now merged together. The village now stretches for about 1.5 miles along the main road -A367. There is a new youth club situated alongside the old school providing a stark contrast in building styles. The youth club offers a wide range of activities, and there is also a play group which hold sessions there each morning.
The village also has very well supported football and cricket clubs. The Catholic club of St Josephs is a social club situated near Ashgrove.
